required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MRI Development for Radiotherapy Planning and Delivery in Non-Patient Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: MRI Development for Radiotherapy Planning and Delivery in Non-Patient Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: Non-patient volunteers will be scanned on the MR-Linac and MRSIM to facilitate the development, optimisation and validation of MRI protocols at The Christie NHS Foundation Trust.

primary_outcome.measure: Developed and optimised of MRI scanning sequences for use in clinical radiotherapy practice in MR guided radiotherapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion - up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: on-going development of MRI protocols to be released for clinical use

clinical_study.condition: Focus of the Study is MRI Sequence Development

study_pop.textblock: Personnel at The Christie NHS Foundation Trust

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Willing and able to provide written consent
- Volunteers must undergo and satisfy MRI safety screening
- Volunteers must be â‰¥ 16 years of age
- Participants must agree to registration as a non-patient in CWP (the Trust's Electronic Health Record - EHR- system) and have their MRIs read and reported for incidental findings by a clinical radiologist
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any contraindications to MRI identified after MRI safety screening including completion of an MRI Safety Screening Form
- Unable to tolerate MRI scan
- Known Pregnancy
- Known or suspected pathology in body region to be scanned
- Member of study team

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of Radiotherapy Research and Development
